CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: b The polydispersity index was calculated from : PDI = M w / M n .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polydispersity index |
| Mw |
| Mn |

Note: Mw and Mn are abbreviations for molecular weight averages, specifically weight-average molecular weight (Mw) and number-average molecular weight (Mn). Since the question asks for the "Material Name" entities, I have included these terms in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polydispersity index |

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, the only clear "Material Name" entity is the "polydispersity index". Mw and Mn are not material names but rather molecular weight averages, which are calculated from a material's molecular weight distribution.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: b The polydispersity index was calculated from : PDI = M w / M n .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| polydispersity index |
| Mw |
| Mn |

In this paragraph, the "Property Name" entities refer to the polydispersity index, Mw (weight-average molecular weight), and Mn (number-average molecular weight). These terms are used to describe the distribution of molecular weights in a polymer sample.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| polydispersity index |

In this revised table, I have removed the entities Mw and Mn, as they do not clearly refer to material properties in the context of the paragraph. The polydispersity index (PDI) is a dimensionless quantity that characterizes the distribution of molecular weights in a polymer sample. It is calculated as the ratio of Mw to Mn.
